body: Noticed that `CommandUtil.verifyAppInitialized()` also creates a curator.
One possible way to handle this issue is to only use the fluo-conn.props if ZK not initialized.
I added this task to https://helpwanted.apache.org

> I'd like to pick up this task if if that's alright.

That would be great @kpm1985 I will assign the task to you.  Let us know if you have any questions.  Below are the commands to build the javadoc.

```bash
# build javadoc
mvn clean package javadoc:javadoc -DskipTests
# open javadoc w/ browswer and look at FluoConfiguration
firefox modules/api/target/site/apidocs/index.html
```

Is there some clever way where I can squash those 5 commits into 1, there really is no points for 5 commits on documentation is there?

@kpm1985 Hi, you can checkout this [StackOverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5189560/squash-my-last-x-commits-together-using-git) answer on squashing commits. They can also be squashed at the time of being merged in.

```
[INFO] --- maven-checkstyle-plugin:2.17:check (check-style) @ fluo-api ---
[WARNING] src/main/java/org/apache/fluo/api/config/FluoConfiguration.java:[280] (javadoc) NonEmptyAtclauseDescription: At-clause should have a non-empty description.
[WARNING] src/main/java/org/apache/fluo/api/config/FluoConfiguration.java:[281] (javadoc) NonEmptyAtclauseDescription: At-clause should have a non-empty description.
[WARNING] src/main/java/org/apache/fluo/api/config/FluoConfiguration.java:[297] (javadoc) AtclauseOrder: At-clauses have to appear in the order '[@param, @return, @throws, @deprecated]'.
[WARNING] src/main/java/org/apache/fluo/api/config/FluoConfiguration.java:[858] (javadoc) NonEmptyAtclauseDescription: At-clause should have a non-empty description.
```
The build is reporting some check-style problems in the javadoc.

> Is there some clever way where I can squash those 5 commits into 1, there really is no points for 5 commits on documentation is there?

We can squash the commits after the review is finished.  It easier on the reviewers not to squash during the review, it makes it harder to know whats changed.

> Is there some clever way where I can squash those 5 commits into 1, there really is no points for 5 commits on documentation is there?

If you are new to git one thing that I found useful when learning git was creating local branches to experiment.  For example if you are on branch foo and want to experiment with squashing could do something like the following.

```
git checkout -b foo-experiment
# experiment with squashing

# diff foo and foo-experiment branches to see if have same content
git diff foo

git checkout foo
git branch -d foo-experiment
```
Here is the next revision. I think I hit everything on the review but if I missed something let me know.

![fluodark](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4433284/31109868-543fea8e-a820-11e7-897a-2c52d2919cb0.png)
@KrishAmal looks good.  Yeah, only need to change the dark logo.
@KrishAmal these changes look good. Your commit has an invalid email address, is that what you intended?

> Perhaps we should pick an entirely different color? Something like a pale/neon yellow?

I think it would be best to discuss this in a separate issue because the light and dark logos would both need to be considered for consistency.  Also, the drip was supposed to be a liquid, presumably water?  So maybe the `u` should change color?  Also, I think this would be best discussed in an issue.  

This PR fixes the problem of the current dark logo not working well with dark backgrounds.

Mountain Dew is a yellow fluid, and at least one Fluo contributor drinks excessive quantities of that :smile:

I'm not sure that my comment requires a new issue... consistency and color change wasn't really my point. I was really just thinking about the dark themed image on its own, and whether this particular change makes the dark themed image look better. I'm not convinced it does. It may be more visible, but I think the color similarity with the other blue makes it look somewhat worse.

I only suggested a color change, because I'm not sure a different shade of blue would look any better. But perhaps if we just go for a much lighter blue, near-white, it would look better?

>  but I think the color similarity with the other blue makes it look somewhat worse.

IMO this is better than the currently checked in version in which the drip is barely visible on a dark background.  

> I only suggested a color change, because I'm not sure a different shade of blue would look any better. But perhaps if we just go for a much lighter blue, near-white, it would look better?

I am not sure, choosing colors is not something I am good at.  If you have something specific in mind it might be helpful to specify the RGB coordinates.

I played around with a few settings in GIMP, and I think the dark blue looks way better on a pure black (000000) background, and many other dark background colors (660505, 070858). But it looks terrible on other dark backgrounds, like dark grey (4e4e4e) or dark green (075808). It's probably not so much a matter of "dark background" vs. "light background", but what specific colors.

Maybe this issue needs to be more specific about which background color it looks bad on, so it can be tweaked for that background? For pure black, I think it looks fine as is.

Regardless, I'm not sure moving the drip to such a similar color as the `u` is a good idea. Regardless of background, I don't think it's good to have them be so similar, but slightly off. I'd be more okay with the same color being used twice.
For reference, the dark version is currently being used on a dark grey (333333) background at https://fluo.apache.org ; that's probably the background color which is driving this.

> It's probably not so much a matter of "dark background" vs. "light background", but what specific colors.

Makes sense. Testing with the website would be nice.

The color that prompted me to open the issue was the twitter logo as mentioned in the issue #815 .

>  I'd be more okay with the same color being used twice.

I am ok with that and I am also ok with the current change.

Ah, I took a look at the Twitter logo. I like that color better. It's closer to the original, and sufficiently distinct from the `u` to not bother me, but it may only work on that particular shade of gray background.

To be clear, I think the color in this change is okay also. It's just a bit of an "uncanny valley" sort of thing for me. It's just *so* close but ever so slightly different from the `u`, that it stands out for me as off-putting. But, the color itself isn't a problem. I just think it'd be better if it were more different or identical than in that valley.

In any case, please feel free to adopt whatever you think works best. I'm only offering feedback from one person's pair of eyes, not a `-1`. If it works for everyone else, go for it. :smile:
@keith-turner Thanks for pointing it out , it was not intended . I've Changed the Email address.

Also we like to mention first contributions on Twitter at [@ApacheFluo](https://twitter.com/apachefluo).  Are you ok with that?   If so, do you have a twitter username we could mention?
The build ran faster, but mini accumulo still started.   I looked into skipping it if `skipITs` is set but maven does not support activation based on multiple properties.
It already skips when `skipTests` is set.  Seems there is no easy way to skip when `skipTests` or `skipITs` is set.

Thanks for letting me work on this, I'd definitely be interested in working on other issues in the future. I'd like to be added as a contributor, I'll look into making a PR. I don't mind you mentioning me on Twitter, my username is @jkosh44.
